sen.j: 大伴 安麻呂（おおとも の やすまろ、生年不明 - 和銅7年5月1日（714年6月21日））は、日本の飛鳥時代から奈良時代の人物である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yasumaro (date of birth unknown - 21 July 714) was a person who lived in the Nara and Aska Period.
OTOMO no Yasumaro (date of birth unknown - 21 July 714) was a person who lived during the Nara and Aska Periods.
OTOMO no Yasumaro (date of birth unknown - 21 June 714) was a person who lived during the Nara and Asuka Periods.

sen.j: 名は安麿とも書く。
sen.e: His name is also spelled as 安麿.
His name is also spelled 安麿.
His name is also spelled 安麿.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いでの読みは「おほとものやすまろ」。
sen.e: It is read as 'OHOTOMO no Yasumaro' in old Japanese.
It is read as 'OHOTOMO no Yasumaro' in old Japanese.
It is read as 'OHOTOMO no Yasumaro' in old Japanese.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は連、後に宿禰。
sen.e: His hereditary title was Muraji and later became Sukune.
His hereditary title was Muraji and later it became Sukune.
His hereditary title was Muraji and later it became Sukune.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱では大海人皇子（天武天皇）の側に立ち、大伴吹負からの連絡の使者になった。
sen.e: He was on Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) side during the Jinshin War in 672 and became an envoy to receive messages from OTOMO no Fukei.
He was on Prince Oama's (Emperor Tenmu) side during the Jinshin War during 672 and became an envoy to receive messages from OTOMO no Fukei.
He was on Prince Oama's (Emperor Tenmu) side during the Jinshin War during 672 and became an envoy to receive messages from OTOMO no Fukei.

sen.j: 兄大伴御行の死後、702年に朝政に参議し、705年に大納言になった。
sen.e: After the death of his brother OTOMO no Miyuki, he entered the Imperial court in 702 and became Dainagon (Major Councilor) in 705.
After the death of his brother OTOMO no Miyuki, he entered the Imperial court during 702 and became Dainagon (Major Councilor) during 705.
After the death of his brother OTOMO no Miyuki, he entered the Imperial court during 702 and became Dainagon (Major Councilor) during 705.

sen.j: 大納言兼大将軍正三位、贈従二位。
sen.e: He was a Dainagon Major Councilor) and Daishogun (Commander-in-Chief) Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and given the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) after his death.
He was a Dainagon Major Councilor) and Daishogun (Commander-in-Chief) Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and given the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) after his death.
He was a Dainagon (Major Councilor) and Daishogun (Commander-in-Chief) Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and given the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank) after his death.
sen.cmt: カッコを補足しました。

sen.j: 大伴氏は飛鳥時代から奈良時代にかけて有力氏族であった。
sen.e: The Otomo was a powerful clan during the Aska and Nara Period.
The Otomo was a powerful clan during the Aska and Nara Periods.
The Otomo was a powerful clan during the Aska and Nara Periods.

sen.j: 安麻呂は大伴長徳の第6子で、大伴御行の弟。
sen.e: Yasumaro was the sixth child of OTOMO no Nagatoko and a younger brother of OTOMO no Miyuki.
Yasumaro was the sixth child of OTOMO no Nagatoko and the younger brother of OTOMO no Miyuki.
Yasumaro was the sixth child of OTOMO no Nagatoko and the younger brother of OTOMO no Miyuki.

sen.j: 叔父に大伴馬来田、大伴吹負がいる。
sen.e: OTOMO no Makuta and OTOMO no Fukei were his uncles.
OTOMO no Makuta and OTOMO no Fukei were his uncles.
OTOMO no Makuta and OTOMO no Fukei were his uncles.

sen.j: 妻には巨勢郎女、石川内命婦、子には大伴旅人、大伴田主、大伴宿奈麻呂、大伴稲公、大伴坂上郎女がいる。
sen.e: He had KOSE no Iratsume and ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu as his wives, and OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, OTOMO no Sukunamaro, OTOMO no Inakimi and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume as his children.
He had KOSE no Iratsume and ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu as his wives, and OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, OTOMO no Sukunamaro, OTOMO no Inakimi and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume as his children.
He had KOSE no Iratsume and ISHIKAWA no Uchimyobu as his wives, and OTOMO no Tabito, OTOMO no Tanushi, OTOMO no Sukunamaro, OTOMO no Inakimi and OTOMO no Sakanoue no Iratsume as his children.

tit.e: Reigns of Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito
Reigns of Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito
Reigns of Emperor Tenmu and Empress Jito

sen.j: 壬申の年（672年）の6月、大海人皇子が近江の朝廷に対して兵を興すため東国に向かうと、倭（大和国）の自宅にいた大伴吹負は皇子のために同志を募り、「一、二の族および諸豪傑」あわせて数十人を得た。
sen.e: In June, 672, when he headed to Azuma Province to raise an army against the Imperial court, OTOMO no Fukei, who was at his house in Wa (Yamato Province), searched for allies and acquired a few dozen people including 'heroic figures and two greatest members from the clan.'

In June, 672, when he headed to Azuma Province to raise an army against the Imperial court, OTOMO no Fukei, who was at his house in Wa (Yamato Province), searched for allies and acquired a few dozen people including 'heroic figures and two of the greatest members from the clan.'

In June, 672, when he headed to Togoku (the eastern part of Japan) to raise an army against the Imperial court at Omi, OTOMO no Fukei, who was at his house in Wa (Yamato Province), searched for allies and acquired a few dozen people including 'heroic figures and two of the greatest members from the clan.'
sen.cmt: 東国の訳を変えました。at Omiを補足しました。

sen.j: 「一、二の族」の中に、大伴安麻呂があったと思われる。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yasumaro is thought to be included in this 'one of the best members.'
OTOMO no Yasumaro is thought to have been included as 'one of the best members.'
OTOMO no Yasumaro is thought to have been included as 'one of the best members.'

sen.j: 吹負は29日に挙兵し、敵の内応によって倭京を奪取した。
sen.e: Fukei raised an army on 29 and was able to get the city in Yamato as there was a betrayer in the enemy.
Fukei raised an army on 29 and was able to capture the city in Yamato as there was a betrayer amongst the enemy.
Fukei raised an army on 29 and was able to capture the city in Yamato as there was a betrayer amongst the enemy.

sen.j: この成功を美濃国の不破宮に報じる使者に、大伴安麻呂、坂上老、佐味宿那麻呂がなった。
sen.e: OTOMO no Yasumaro, Sakanoue no Okina, and Sami no Sukunamaro were chosen to report this success to Fuwanomiya in Mino Province.
OTOMO no Yasumaro, Sakanoue no Okina, and Sami no Sukunamaro were chosen to report this success to Fuwanomiya in Mino Province.
OTOMO no Yasumaro, Sakanoue no Okina, and Sami no Sukunamaro were chosen to report this success to Fuwanomiya in Mino Province.

sen.j: 彼らは無事に任務を果たしたらしい。
sen.e: They successfully accomplished their task.
They successfully accomplished their task.
They successfully accomplished their task.

sen.j: 宿那麻呂はこの後とって返して吹負の下で戦ったが、安麻呂のその後の行動は不明である。
sen.e: Although Yasumaro returned immediately and fought under Fukei, it is unknown what happened to Tasumaro after that.
Although Yasumaro returned immediately and fought under Fukei, it is unknown what happened to Tasumaro after that.
Although Yasumaro returned immediately and fought under Fukei, it is unknown what happened to Tasumaro after that.

sen.j: 同様に吹負のもとに返ったかもしれないが、別の方面にいたかもしれない。
sen.e: He might have returned to Fukei like he did, or he might have gone in the opposite direction.
He might have returned to Fukei, or he might have gone in the opposite direction.
He might have returned to Fukei, or he might have gone in the opposite direction.

sen.j: 天武天皇12年（684年）2月28日、広瀬王と大伴安麻呂が、判官、録事、陰陽師、工匠を引き連れて畿内を回り、都の候補地を探した。
sen.e: On February 28, 684, Prince Hirose and OTOMO no Yasumaro took an inspector, a secretary, a carpenter and the Yin Yang Master to Kinai region to look for possible locations for the next capital.
On February 28, 684, Prince Hirose and OTOMO no Yasumaro took an inspector, a secretary, a carpenter and the Yin Yang Master to the Kinai region to look for possible locations for the next capital.
On February 28, 684, Prince Hirose and OTOMO no Yasumaro took an inspector, a secretary, a carpenter and the Yin Yang Master to the Kinai region to look for possible locations for the next capital.

sen.j: 大伴連安麻呂の位は、このとき小錦中であった。
sen.e: His then rank was Shokinchu.
His rank then was Shokinchu.
His rank then was Shokinchu.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年12月2日に、大伴連など50氏が宿禰の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On December 2, 685, 50 people including OTOMO no Muraji were given the hereditary title of Sukune.
On December 2, 685, fifty people including OTOMO no Muraji were given the hereditary title of Sukune.
On December 2, 685, fifty people including OTOMO no Muraji were given the hereditary title of Sukune.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）1月、新羅の使者金智祥を接待するために、川内王、大伴安麻呂、藤原大島、境部このしろ、穂積虫麻呂が筑紫に使わされた。
sen.e: In January, 686, Prince Kawachi, OTOMO no Yasumaro, FUJUWARA no Oshima, SAKAIBE no Konoshiro and HOZUMI no Mushimaro were sent to Chikushi to welcome an envoy from Silla, Chisho KON.
In January, 686, Prince Kawachi, OTOMO no Yasumaro, FUJUWARA no Oshima, SAKAIBE no Konoshiro and HOZUMI no Mushimaro were sent to Chikushi to welcome an envoy from Silla, Chisho KON.

sen.j: 大伴宿禰安麻呂は、このとき直広参であった。
sen.e: OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro had a rank Jikikosan then.
OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro held the rank Jikikosan then.
OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro held the rank Jikikosan then.

sen.j: 9月9日に天武天皇が死ぬと、28日にその殯で直広参の大伴宿禰安麻呂が大蔵のことを誄した。
sen.e: When the Emperor Tenmu died on September 9, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura.
When Emperor Tenmu died on September 9, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura.
When Emperor Tenmu died on September 9, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura.

sen.j: 持統天皇2年（688年）8月10日、天武天皇の殯宮で、嘗して慟哭する儀式があった。
sen.e: On August 10, 688, there was a mourning ceremony held in the Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu where people got together.
On August 10, 688, there was a mourning ceremony held in the Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu where people got together.
On August 10, 688, there was a mourning ceremony held in the Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu where people got together.

sen.j: このとき大伴宿禰安麻呂が誅を述べた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro presented an eulogy then.
OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro presented an eulogy then.
OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro presented an eulogy then.

sen.j: 文武朝のはじめまで、大伴氏の氏上は兄の大伴御行であり、安麻呂が政治の中枢に加わることはなかった。
sen.e: The head of Otomo clan was his brother OTOMO no Miyuki and therefore Yasumaro never played a crucial role in the government until the beginning of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The head of Otomo clan was his brother OTOMO no Miyuki and therefore Yasumaro never played a crucial role in the government until the beginning of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.
The head of Otomo clan was his brother OTOMO no Miyuki and therefore Yasumaro never played a crucial role in the government until the beginning of the reign of Emperor Tenmu.

sen.j: しかし大宝元年（701年）1月15日に御行が死ぬと、安麻呂が大伴氏の最高位となり、翌年には朝政に参議するようになった。
sen.e: However, when Miyuki died on January 15, Yasumaro became the head of Otomo clan and began participating in the Imperial Court.
However, when Miyuki died on January 15, Yasumaro became the head of the Otomo clan and began participating in the Imperial Court.
However, when Miyuki died on January 15, Yasumaro became the head of the Otomo clan and began participating in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）3月21日、大宝律令にもとづく官位が授けられたとき、直大壱大伴宿禰安麻呂は正従三位に進んだ。
sen.e: On March 21, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted from Jikidaiichi to Shojusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
On March 21, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted from Jikidaiichi to Shojusanmi (Junior Third Rank).
On March 21, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted from Jikidaiichi to Shojusanmi (Junior Third Rank).

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）1月17日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は式部卿になった。
sen.e: On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu.
On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu.
On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu.

sen.j: 同年5月21日、粟田真人、高向麻呂、下毛野古麻呂、小野毛野とともに、朝政に参議することを命じられた。
sen.e: On May 21 of the same year, he was ordered to be a part of the Imperial court along with AWATA no Mahito, TAKAMUKO no Maro, SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro and ONO no Kenu.
On May 21 of the same year, he was ordered to be a part of the Imperial court along with AWATA no Mahito, TAKAMUKO no Maro, SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro and ONO no Kenu.
On May 21 of the same year, he was ordered to be a part of the Imperial court along with AWATA no Mahito, TAKAMUKO no Maro, SHIMOTSUKENU no Komaro and ONO no Kenu.

sen.j: これが参議のはじめで、このときは参議という官職に任命されたのではなく、「参議する」という仕事を命じられたのである。
sen.e: This was the beginning of the council and although at this time he was not assigned as the Councilor, he was given a job 'to participate.'
This was the beginning of the council and although at this time he was not assigned as the Councilor, he was given a job in order 'to participate.'
This was the beginning of the council and although at this time he was not assigned as the Councilor, he was given a job in order 'to participate.'

sen.j: 同年6月24日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は、兵部卿になった。
sen.e: On June 24 of the same year, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry for Military Affairs.
On June 24 of the same year, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry for Military Affairs.

sen.j: 以上は『続日本紀』によるもので、『公卿補任』は細部が異なる。
sen.e: The above was mentioned in "Shoku Nihongi" (Chronicle of Japan Continued), and "Kugyobunin" states slightly different details.

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）3月19日に安麿が従三位、中納言になり、21日に中納言をやめて散位になったとする。
sen.e: It says that Maro was given the position of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) on March 19, 701, and became Sanni (government official without a post).
It says that Maro was given the position of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) on March 19, 701, and became Sanni (government official without a post).

It says that Yasumaro was given the position of Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) on March 19, 701, but on 21, he resigned from Chunagon and became Sanni (government official without a post).
sen.cmt: [21日に中納言をやめて」の部分を補足しました。

sen.j: 翌年に式部卿というのは同じだが、二箇所で1月7日と4月7日の異なる日付を記す。
sen.e: Although where it says about him becoming Shikibukyo (the head of the Ministry of Shikibu is the same, it gives different dates, January 1 and April 7, in two parts.

sen.j: それから5月17日に参議になり、6月19日に兵部卿を兼ねたとする。
sen.e: Furthermore, it states that he became the councilor on May 17, and held a concurrent position of the head of the Minister for Military Affairs) on June 19.
Furthermore, it states that he became councilor on May 17, and held a concurrent position of the head of the Minister for Military Affairs) on June 19.
Furthermore, it states that he became councilor on May 17, and held a concurrent position of the head of the Minister for Military Affairs) on June 19.

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）8月11日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は、大納言になった。
sen.e: On August 11, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor).
On August 11, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor).

sen.j: 11月28日に、大納言従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は大宰帥を兼ね、その大弐に石川宮麻呂が任命された。
sen.e: On November 28, Dainagon (Major Council) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro concurrently worked as Dazai no sochi, and ISONOKAMI no Miyamaro was assigned as his assistant.
On November 28, Dainagon (Major Council) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro concurrently worked as Dazai no sochi, and ISONOKAMI no Miyamaro was assigned as his assistant.

sen.j: これも『公卿補任』では異なり、安麿が4月20日に中納言、8月1日に大納言、11月14日に大宰帥を兼ねたとする。
sen.e: "Kugyobunin" states different dates for when Maro became Chunagon on April 20 and Dainagon on August 1 and held a concurrent position of Dazai no sochi on November 14.
"Kugyobunin" states different dates for when Maro became Chunagon on April 20 and Dainagon on August 1 and he held a concurrent position of Dazai no sochi on November 14.
"Kugyobunin" states different dates for when Yasumaro became Chunagon on April 20 and Dainagon on August 1 and he held a concurrent position of Dazai no sochi on November 14.

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）3月13日に、正三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は大納言になった。
sen.e: On March 13, 708, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Council).
On March 13, 708, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Council).

sen.j: 大納言は3年前と同じだが、この事情はよくわからない。
sen.e: It is unknown why the same event that happened 3 years ago was stated once again.
It is unknown why the same event that happened three years previous was stated once again.
It is unknown why the same event that happened three years previous was stated once again.

sen.j: 『公卿補任』は同じ月の12日に正三位になり、安麿が大宰師をやめたと記すだけである。
sen.e: According to "Kugyobunin," Maro was promoted to Sosanmi (Junior Third Rank) on March 12 and left the position of Dazai no sochi.
According to "Kugyobunin," Maro was promoted to Sosanmi (Junior Third Rank) on March 12 and left the position of Dazai no sochi.
According to "Kugyobunin," Yasumaro was promoted to Shosanmi (Junior Third Rank) on March 12 and left the position of Dazai no sochi.

sen.j: 7月15日、元明天皇は、議政官とそれ以外の高級官人とを分けてそれぞれに訓示を与えた。
sen.e: On July 15, the Empress Genmei separated councilors and the rest of the government officials of high ranks and gave each a different instruction.
On July 15, Empress Genmei separated councilors and the rest of the government officials of high ranks and gave each different instructions.
On July 15, Empress Genmei separated councilors and the rest of the government officials of high ranks and gave each different instructions.

sen.j: 大納言大伴宿禰安麻呂は前者のうちにあった。
sen.e: Dainagon (Major Councilor) no Tasumaro was in the former group.
Dainagon (Major Councilor) no Tasumaro was in the former group.
Dainagon (Major Councilor) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was in the former group.

sen.j: 和銅7年（714年）5月1日に、大納言兼大将軍正三位大伴宿禰安麻呂は死んだ。
sen.e: Dainagon(Major Councilor) as well as Commander in Chief Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro died on May 1, 714.
Dainagon(Major Councilor) as well as Commander in Chief Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro died on May 1, 714.
Dainagon(Major Councilor) as well as Commander in Chief Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro died on May 1, 714.

sen.j: 元明天皇は深く悼み、従二位を贈った。
sen.e: The Empress Genmei mourned over his death and offered him Junii (Junior Second Rank).
Empress Genmei mourned over his death and offered him Junii (Junior Second Rank).
Empress Genmei mourned over his death and offered him Junii (Junior Second Rank).

sen.j: 『公卿補任』によれば、このとき鈴鹿王らが遣わされた。
sen.e: According to "Kugyobunin," Prince Suzuka was sent for this task.
According to "Kugyobunin," Prince Suzuka was sent for this task.

sen.j: 永隆寺創建
sen.e: Foundation of Eiryu-ji Temple

sen.j: 永隆寺は、大伴氏の氏寺で伴寺とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Eiryu-ji Temple was a temple for the Otomo clan and referred as Tomo-dera Temple.
Eiryu-ji Temple was a temple for the Otomo clan and referred as Tomo-dera Temple.
Eiryu-ji Temple was a temple for the Otomo clan and referred as Tomo-dera Temple.

sen.j: 平安時代に成立した『東大寺要録』には、永隆寺は大伴安麿が建立したものとある。
sen.e: It is said in the "Todaijiyoroku" written in Heian Period that it was bult by OTOMO no Yasumaro.
It is said in the "Todaijiyoroku," written during the Heian Period, that it was bult by OTOMO no Yasumaro.
It is said in the "Todaijiyoroku," written during the Heian Period, that it was built by OTOMO no Yasumaro.

sen.j: それによれば飯高天皇（元正天皇）の世の養老2年（718年）に奈良坂東阿古屋谷に永隆寺が立ったとする。
sen.e: According to the book, Eiryu-ji Temple was bulit in Narazaka Higashi Akoya Valley during the reign of Empress (Emperess Gensho), 718.
According to the book, Eiryu-ji Temple was bulit in Narazaka Higashi Akoya Valley during the reign of Empress (Emperess Gensho), 718.
According to the book, Eiryu-ji Temple was built in Narazaka Higashi Akoya Valley during the reign of Empress Iitaka (Empress Gensho), in 718.

sen.j: しかし養老2年は安麻呂の死から数年の後である。
sen.e: However, it is a few years later since the death of Yasumaro.
However, it was a few years after the death of Yasumaro.
However, it was a few years after the death of Yasumaro.

tit.e: Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events
Chronological list of the main events

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）6月29日。
sen.e: On June 29, 672
On June 29, 672
On June 29, 672

sen.j: 大伴連安麻呂が倭京から不破宮に使者として遣わされた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro was sent from the city of Yamato to Fuwanomiya-Palace. as an envoy.
OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro was sent from the city of Yamato to Fuwanomiya-Palace. as an envoy.
OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro was sent from the city of Yamato to Fuwanomiya-Palace as an envoy.
sen.cmt: 余分なピリオドを削除しました。

sen.j: 天武天皇12年（684年）2月28日。
sen.e: On Febuary 28, 684
On Febuary 28, 684
On February 28, 684

sen.j: 大伴連安麻呂が畿内で都の地を探した。
sen.e: OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro searched for possible locations for the next capital in Kinai region.
OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro searched for possible locations for the next capital in the Kinai region.
OTOMO no Muraji Yasumaro searched for possible locations for the next capital in the Kinai region.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（685年）12月2日。
sen.e: On December 2, 685
On December 2, 685
On December 2, 685

sen.j: 大伴連が宿禰の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: OTOMO no Muraji was given the hereditary title of Sukune.
OTOMO no Muraji was given the hereditary title of Sukune.
OTOMO no Muraji was given the hereditary title of Sukune.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）1月、新羅の使者金智祥を接待するために直広参大伴宿禰安麻呂が遣わされた。
sen.e: In January, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was sent to welcome an envoy from Silla, Chisho KON.
In January, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was sent to welcome an envoy from Silla, Chisho KON.
In January, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was sent to welcome an envoy from Silla, Chisho KON.

sen.j: 朱鳥元年（686年）9月28日、直広参の大伴宿禰安麻呂が、天武天皇の殯で大蔵のことを誄した。
sen.e: On September 28, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura at Emperor Tenmu's funeral.
On September 28, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura at Emperor Tenmu's funeral.
On September 28, 686, Jikikosan OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro killed Okura at Emperor Tenmu's funeral.

sen.j: 持統天皇2年（688年）8月10日、天武天皇の殯宮で嘗したとき、大伴宿禰安麻呂が誅を述べた。
sen.e: On August 10, 688, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro read an eulogy in Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu (funeral parlor).
On August 10, 688, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro read an eulogy in Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu (funeral parlor).
On August 10, 688, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro read an eulogy in Emperor Tenmu's Hinkyu (funeral parlor).

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）3月19日、大伴宿禰安麿が従三位、中納言になった。（『公卿補任』）
sen.e: On March 19, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) ("Kugyobunin").
On March 19, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) ("Kugyobunin").
On March 19, 701, OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) Chunagon (Middle Councilor) ("Kugyobunin").

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）3月21日、直大壱大伴宿禰安麻呂が正従三位に進んだ。
sen.e: On March 21, 701, Jikidaiichi OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shojusanmi.
On March 21, 701, Jikidaiichi OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shojusanmi.
On March 21, 701, Jikidaiichi OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shojusanmi.

sen.j: 大宝元年（701年）3月21日、従三位大伴宿禰安麿が中納言をやめ散位になった。（『公卿補任』）
sen.e: On March 21, 701, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) left the position of Chunagon (Middle Councilor) and became Sanni (a government official without any post) ("Kugyobunin").
On March 21, 701, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) left the position of Chunagon (Middle Councilor) and became Sanni (a government official without any post) ("Kugyobunin").
On March 21, 701, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank), OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro left the position of Chunagon (Middle Councilor) and became Sanni (a government official without any post) ("Kugyobunin").
sen.cmt: OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaroを補足しました。

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）1月17日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が式部卿になった。（『公卿補任』では1月7日と4月7日）
sen.e: On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu (the dates are January 7 and April 7 in "Kugyobunin").
On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu (the dates are January 7 and April 7 in "Kugyobunin").
On January 17, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Ministry of Shikibu (the dates are January 7 and April 7 in "Kugyobunin").

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）5月21日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が朝政に参議することを命じられた。
sen.e: On May 21, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro received an order to participate in the Imperial Court.
On May 21, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro received an order to participate in the Imperial Court.
On May 21, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro received an order to participate in the Imperial Court.

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）6月24日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が兵部卿になった。
sen.e: On June 24, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became the head of the Minister for Military Affairs.
On June 24, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became head of the Minister for Military Affairs.
On June 24, 702, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became head of the Minister for Military Affairs.

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）4月20日、従三位大伴宿禰安麿が中納言になった。
sen.e: On April 20, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Chunagon (Middle Councilor) ("Kugyobunin").
On April 20, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Chunagon (Middle Councilor) ("Kugyobunin").
On April 20, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Chunagon (Middle Councilor).

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）8月11日、従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が大納言になった。
sen.e: On August 11, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor) (it is August 1 in "Kugyobunin").
On August 11, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor) (August 1 in the "Kugyobunin").
On August 11, 705, Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor) (August 1 in the "Kugyobunin").

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）11月28日に、大納言従三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が大宰帥を兼ねた。
sen.e: On November 28, 705, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro held a concurrent position of Dazai no sochi (it is November 14 in "Kugyobunin").
On November 28, 705, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro held the concurrent position of Dazai no sochi (November 14 in the "Kugyobunin").
On November 28, 705, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro held the concurrent position of Dazai no sochi (November 14 in the "Kugyobunin").

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）3月12日に、大納言従三位大伴宿禰安麿が正三位になり、大宰帥を辞めた。
sen.e: On March 12, 708, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and left the position of Dazai no sochi ("Kugyobunin").
On March 12, 708, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and left the position of Dazai no sochi ("Kugyobunin").
On March 12, 708, Dainagon (Major Councilor) Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro was promoted to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) and left the position of Dazai no sochi.

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）3月13日に、正三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が大納言になった。
sen.e: On March 13, 708, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor).
On March 13, 708, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor).
On March 13, 708, Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro became Dainagon (Major Councilor).

sen.j: 和銅7年（714年）5月1日に、大納言兼大将軍正三位大伴宿禰安麻呂が死んだ。
sen.e: On May 1, 714, Dainagon (Major Councilor) as well as Commander-in-Chief Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro died.
On May 1, 714, Dainagon (Major Councilor) as well as Commander-in-Chief Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) OTOMO no Sukune Yasumaro died.

sen.j: 従二位を贈られた。
sen.e: He received the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank).
He received the rank of Junii (Junior Second Rank).
